statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: George Mason 87, McNeese State 76
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. (AP) -- John Ford scored all of his 19 points in the second half to lead McNeese State to an 87-76 victory over George Mason on Tuesday night. Ford shot 6-of-8 from the floor and 7-of-9 on free throws as McNeese (5-6) built on a 36-31 halftime lead. Ronald Dorsey scored 21 for the Cowboys while Edward Garriet had 11. Jai Lewis and Tony Skinn scored 20 points each George Mason (5-4), while Lamar Butler had 13 and Gabe Norwood 11. Lewis also had 13 rebounds as Mason outrebounded McNeese 37-34. There were eight ties and 17 lead changes in the game. The Cowboys took the lead for good on a pair of free throws by Aldrynn Wardell and a bucket by Ford midway the second half. Wardell also had three blocked shots. McNeese shot 50.9 percent, including 8-of-16 shooting from 3-point range. The Cowboys also went 21-of-26 on free throws. George Mason shot 40.7 percent and hit 24 of 32 foul shots. Most of the second half was played with only two referees. The other, Bobby Vetkoetter, injured his knee and had to sit out the rest of the game. The victory snapped a three-game losing streak for the Cowboys, who were playing their final non-conference game of the year. <
